    Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough

    Compensation Analysis Tool (COAT): Walkthrough

    coat-walkthrough.Rmd
    
```r
library(coat)
library(dplyr)

    ğŸ” Introduction

    This vignette demonstrates how to use the coat R package to calculate overload compensation for instructors based on institutional course schedules and compensation policies.

    The package supports both individual instructor analysis and full-schedule summaries, applying proration and eligibility rules based on enrollment and credit hours.

    ğŸ« Load Schedule 

    schedule <- read.csv("data-raw/schedule.csv")

    ğŸ‘¤ Get Schedule for One Instructor 

    get_instructor_schedule("Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha", schedule)

    ğŸ’µ Calculate Overload Compensation for One Instructor 

    IS <- get_instructor_schedule("Lalau-Hitchcock, Diksha", schedule)
ol_comp(IS)  # Uses default institutional policy

# Custom policy example
ol_comp(IS, L = 4, U = 8, reg_load = 9, rate_per_cr = 5000 / 3)

    ğŸ‘¥ List Unique Instructors in the Schedule 

    get_unique_instructors(schedule)

    ğŸ”¢ Summarize Overload Compensation for an Instructor by Index 

    ol_comp_byindex(108, schedule_df = schedule)
ol_comp_byindex(108, schedule_df = schedule, L = 4, U = 9, rate_per_cr = 2500 / 3, reg_load = 12)

    ğŸ“‹ Summarize All Instructorsâ€™ Overload Compensation 

    ol_comp_summary(schedule)
ol_comp_summary(schedule, L = 4, U = 9, rate_per_cr = 2500 / 3, reg_load = 12)

    ğŸ“ Explanation

    The COAT package determines overload compensation using institutional rules based on:

    • Enrollment (ENRLD)
    • Credit hours (HRS)
    • Regular teaching load (reg_load)
    • Per-credit compensation rate (rate_per_cr)

    Key Concepts:

    • Default Proration Range:

      • Lower Bound (L) = 4
      • Upper Bound (U) = 9
      • Courses with ENRLD < L â†’ No pay
      • Courses with L â‰¤ ENRLD â‰¤ U â†’ Prorated
      • Courses with ENRLD > U â†’ Full pay

    • Regular Load (reg_load): Only credit hours beyond this are eligible for overload compensation (default = 12 credit hours).

    • Rate per Credit Hour (rate_per_cr): Default is 2500 / 3 (â‰ˆ 833.33), but this is adjustable to reflect your institutionâ€™s policy.

    Notes

    • All thresholds and pay rates are user-adjustable via function arguments.
    • Output is returned as a tidy, human-readable tibble, ready for reporting or export.

    ğŸ“« Questions?

    For questions or feedback, contact Dawit Aberra at aberrad@fvsu.edu.
